text: Luge at the 2018 Winter Olympics was held at the Alpensia Sliding Centre near Pyeongchang, South Korea. A total of four luge events were held, between 10 and 15 February 2018. ==Qualification== A maximum of 110 athletes were allowed to compete at the Games. Countries were assigned quotas using the world rankings of results from 1 November 2017 to 31 December 2017. ==Competition schedule== The following was the competition schedule for all four events. All times are (UTC+9). {| class=wikitable ! Date !! Time !! Event |- | 10 February || 19:10 || Men's singles runs 1 and 2 |- | 11 February || 18:50 || style=background:lemonchiffon|Men's singles runs 3 and 4 |- | 12 February || 19:50 || Women's singles runs 1 and 2 |- | 13 February || 19:30 || style=background:lemonchiffon|Women's singles runs 3 and 4 |- | 14 February || 20:20 || style=background:lemonchiffon|Doubles runs 1 and 2 |- | 15 February || 21:30 || style=background:lemonchiffon|Team relay |} ==Medal summary== ===Medal table=== ===Events=== {| |-valign="top" |Men's singlesMen's singles results | |3:10.702 | |3:10.728 | |3:10.932 |-valign="top" |Women's singlesWomen's singles results | |3:05.232 | |3:05.599 | |3:05.644 |-valign="top" |DoublesDoubles results | || 1:31.697 | || 1:31.785 | || 1:31.987 |-valign="top" |Team relayTeam relay results | Natalie Geisenberger Johannes Ludwig Tobias Wendl Tobias Arlt || 2:24.517 | Alex Gough Samuel Edney Tristan Walker Justin Snith || 2:24.872 | Madeleine Egle David Gleirscher Peter Penz Georg Fischler || 2:24.988 |} ==Participating nations== A total of 110 athletes from 24 nations (including the IOC's designation of Olympic Athletes from Russia) were scheduled to participate. The number of athletes for each nation are shown in parentheses. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * ==References== ==External links== *Official Results Book – Luge 2018 Luge Winter Olympics Category:Luge competitions in South Korea
title: Luge at the 2018 Winter Olympics
